stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements is an accurate comparison of the 2009 presidential election in Iran and the 2006 presidential election in Mexico?
choicesHtml: In both elections, the winning candidateâ€™s political party was different from the political party of his predecessor.
In both elections, voter turnout fell below 50%.
In both elections, a runoff election was held to determine the winner.
In both elections, allegations of fraud were brought by the losing party.
In both elections, the winner won with a plurality, but not a majority, of the vote.
